title: $125 DRY up code that cleans up reports when policies are deleted

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
# Problem
We have some code that cleans up reports when a policy is deleted. That code has been duplicated in 3-4 files and is redundant.

### Solution
- Search the code for `// If we are deleting a policy, we have to check every report linked to that policy`
- You will find 3-4 instances of this
- Remove all but one of them
- Verify the functionality still works as intended

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @linhvovan29546</details>

title: [$250] Restore Type Safety for Onyx.update()

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Background: The frontend frequently reads and writes data to the backend using the Onyx data layer. Whenever a request is made, we optimistically set Onyx data via Onyx.update(). First updating the local cache, then syncing changes once the request succeeds/fails. During the migration to TypeScript, @fabioh8010 and I ensured this function and accompanying types were type-safe, meaning only values defined in the Onyx schema could be set under a specific key. This safeguard protected against corrupted data, unexpected keys, and typos in key names, improving developer experience and data reliability. ## Problem: It's possible to set any value to any key when using Onyx.update(): ```ts const optimisticData: OnyxUpdate[] = [ { onyxMethod: Onyx.METHOD.MERGE, key: ONYXKEYS.IS_LOADING_REPORT_DATA, // boolean value: 'whatever value', // this doesn't raise a type error }, ]; ``` ## Solution: Reintroduce the previous type definition in react-native-onyx (as it was implemented before PR #600) to restore schema-based type enforcement. Then: Update react-native-onyx in E/App. Resolve around 120 resulting type errors in E/App This change will restore strict type safety for Onyx.update(), preventing invalid data assignments at compile-time. In React-native-onyx this will also be included: - add a comment above this magic type so that nobody touches it again - add type tests to Onyx

title: [$250] Migrate deprecated blurOnSubmit to submitBehavior

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem React Native has deprecated the [blurOnSubmit](https://reactnative.dev/docs/textinput#bluronsubmit) prop for TextInput, and it will be removed in a future version. However, we have several usages of `blurOnSubmit` left in the app. ### Solution Migrate these usages to use the replacement prop [submitBehavior](https://reactnative.dev/docs/textinput#submitbehavior) instead.

title: [$250] Update error handling in Onyx to prevent unnecessary data eviction

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [this proposal](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1761670058836599) ### Proposal: Update error handling in Onyx to prevent unnecessary data eviction ### Background For the last 7 days, about 7+ million logs with [Onyx] Failed to save to storage ... were reported from different users. Currently, for all errors triggered by Onyx.set, Onyx.multiSet, and Onyx.mergeCollection, the [evictStorageAndRetry](https://github.com/Expensify/react-native-onyx/blob/6a246801d0506293b9e00073e49c622de7476a85/lib/OnyxUtils.ts#L872) function is invoked. ### Problem When evictStorageAndRetry runs without verifying whether the error is storage-capacity related, it always tries to evict user data, causing loss of important information and degraded UI performance (e.g., Hidden items in the LHN when a parent report action is evicted) ### Solution Update evictStorageAndRetry function to evict storage only if the error is storage capacity related. Draft PR: https://github.com/Expensify/react-native-onyx/pull/694/files
